senses.sense_definition: The present participle and gerund of <w>purge</w>.

examples.text: The company is currently <purging> its database of inactive accounts.
She spent the entire weekend <purging> her closet of old clothes.

senses.sense_definition: The act of eliminating contamination or removing undesirable people from a group or organization.

examples.text: The political <purging> of opposition leaders caused international outrage.
Regular <purging> of unnecessary documents keeps the archive organized.

senses.sense_definition: The cleansing of a device or pipe by flushing it with water, steam, or gas.

examples.text: The <purging> of the pipeline must be completed before repairs can begin.
Engineers recommended a nitrogen <purging> to remove oxygen from the tank.

senses.sense_definition: Vomiting, especially when induced by medication or as a symptom of illness.

examples.text: He suffered from violent <purgings> after ingesting the spoiled food.
The doctor asked if the patient had experienced any <purging> or nausea.
